intro: Solenachne, commonly known as the false millet, is a genus of grasses belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spikelet-like inflorescences. The plants typically grow in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Solenachne species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They are generally herbaceous and have narrow, linear leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
